Another great choice could be "Back to the Future Part II", a fun sci-fi comedy featuring time travel and Michael J. Fox's iconic Marty McFly character. Enjoy the ride!

Night Shyamalan, Paul Giamatti, and Bryce Dallas Howard, makes it an enjoyable watch!"

"Another movie you might enjoy is 'Elizabeth.' It's a captivating historical drama that tells the early years of Queen Elizabeth I's reign. Fanny Ardant, Eric Cantona, and John Gielgud deliver compelling performances in this period piece."

Mark Gatiss might not be an actor featured in this movie, but the stellar cast includes Andy Lau and Jet Li.

Mel Gibson delivers a powerful performance as a commander leading his troops into battle. Enjoy your movie time!

I'd highly recommend "In the Land of Blood and Honey." This gripping war drama, set during the Bosnian War, tells a complex tale of love and survival as two former lovers are reunited in a harrowing war camp. Mark Gatiss isn't in this film, but notable actors such as Rade Serbedzija and Goran Kostić deliver powerful performances.

Another captivating choice is "Lord of War," starring Nicolas Cage. This thought-provoking movie follows an arms dealer forced to confront the morality of his actions as he's pursued by an INTERPOL agent, offering a unique perspective on the global arms trade during war times.
